txt.en:
'I did. If she were not soft and coddled, like many of the horse-folk seem to be, she could be one of the Uch-lûth. She has the temperament for it, if not the weathering given by a hard life. I think she was frightened of me, at first, but she had many questions about my people and I enjoyed talking to her about them. The guard-captain did not let her out of his sight while she was in my presence. That put me in mind of a caged bird.

'I would not have tolerated it, but Siflád did. No one would mistake her for me, that is certain.

'She was very curious about Horn. I told her his singing voice is not as fair as he thinks it is, and that he is not my equal in combat. I think she was disappointed.'
